name: Cosmic Relief: Prof. Renegade to the Rescue
description:
This multi-level action/adventure takes players back 40 years to find Professor K.K. Renegade, who predicts that a catastrophic asteroid is heading straight for earth. You're in charge of finding Professor Renegade.

Select one of the five most intrepid Adventurers from England, France, Germany, Japan, and the U.S. to spearhead the search. Professor Renegade was last seen in the unexplored region of the highest Tibetan ranges; an area populated by creatures and conditions of the professor's own design: venomous stone snakes, reptilian birds, and acid storms. Not only must your Adventurer survive these tests of courage, but he must and properly use such curious objects as spurs, a vacuum cleaner, and a unicycle. Once you locate the professor and convince him to help, you'll need to help him construct an anti-asteroid deflector to prevent the destruction of earth. You must now search for high-tech tools such as an atomic pile, a 9-volt battery, and a bent coat hanger!

Use the joystick and the appropriate keys to maneuver the Adventurer across the landscape. You have 30 days to complete the mission. During the mission, the Adventurer collects various items (points are awarded for each). Some items serve little purpose; others are vital; and others only work in certain places. Only one item can be held at a time and it must be held to be used. Native bearers carry the items collected.

To look at what each bearer has, type 1 or 2 to scroll through the bearers. The Adventurer can exchange the item held (press S) with a bearer that is closest to him. Its trial and error time. Good luck. The game comes with cheats and a map for those that require a little help.
alsoFor: Acorn 32-bit, Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, MSX | Combined View

shot.caption: Loading screen
Title screen
Choose your character
Game start
Rising up
On a ledge
Climbed up, but his face says I can't jump
Need to go down (via the next screen) to collect that
The birds mave fixed paths to avoid
Game over
One important thing a player shall do: read the instructions.
A piece of the story of Terramex.
Controls are fundamental. For example "T" is a very important key to get hints for when the player is stuck in a puzzle (although the game is quite easy and this key is not mentioned).
Let's enchant the serpents with a flute.
A well, with a underground world below. I don't know what this tubular entities are, but surely they're unpredictable.
I have this doubt: is this a "Flying squirrel" or a member of the "Flying Dragons"?
Going down the well.
Using the "T" key, something necessary to create a bridge: the "ACME expanding bridge" kit.
Too much confidence leads to this.
I am the Trampoline man!
Bellows and spurs, an old chap at the left.
Using a trick to call for a rope.
Without Bellows no hot air.
Reaching the skies.
No, he's not giving the finger, he realized that having an umbrella is the ticket to get out of there. I tried to communicate with that lying guy, without any feedback.
I think I'm too much light weighted... doesn't look good...
2nd try: inserting the proper barrel of powder... let's see what happens.
And there you are, gracious as a fairy.
"Zero" in informatics, has its beauty.
Peeking through the telescope...
...not good news.
The ladder leading to the telescope room.
Now I understand why a mummy of someone which looks very much alike as my character, is lying next to the teleporter device .
Zero gravity room. I notice that these mummies looking alike as my character are spread all over the scenarios of the game.
Forging a cross with a silver lining.
Chemical laboratories always have a cup of tea.
I'm positive these guys are the Dalton brothers.
Using the hint key. A silver cross!
Get over here you Fangs!
Very dangerous bridge: in opposition to a cautious stepping, this bridge has to be crossed by jumping.
Another trampoline.
Got the energy crystal from the "zero gravity" room, and puzzow! Scott me up Beam!. I wonder if the mummies are also indicators of danger... hum...
- Now you don't forget to take your anti radiation pins before picking the atomic pile!
Switch properly inserted.
A marvellous bucket trip with a dazzling view.
Depending on the nationality of the character there's a idiosyncratic task related to the picking of the secret formula. For the German guy, the traditional social act of drinking beer.
The character has overcome in drinking beer matters the sailor who was guarding the formula. Not a single second to waste! Directly to the professor's lab.
"What are you doing here?" said the professor. "We have to save the word from the menacing meteor!" said the character with an imperceptible English camouflaged by the German pronunciation.

- Do you like my Elton John glasses?
- Please professor, I'm aware of your frustration with Mankind but we don't have much more time...
- Give me a coat hanger, now!!
And so, our Mankind was saved from the giant asteroid by this ingenious apparatus only possible to be created because of the will of these two forgotten heroes.
